As we wrap up this first week of learning at Tri County, we would like to thank you for your work and support . Whether Viking Traditional or Viking Virtual, there has been a lot of change, and we appreciate the support and communication from our parents. We know there have been some technology challenges and major adjustments for Viking Virtual learners. We will continue to look for ways to improve

Please continue to look for communication from the district, buildings and teachers as we continue to work forward this school year. Thank you again for your communication, support and patience as we began this new school year.

Sincerely,
Superintendent Cumings

Congratulations to High School Teacher, Randy Cook, on receiving a Voya Unsung Heros grant. Mr. Cook received $2,000 to be used for a project in his classroom.

Voya Unsung Heroes handed out its first awards in 1996 as a way for Voya Financial to demonstrate its commitment to the education community. Grants are given to K-12 educators utilizing new teaching methods and techniques that improve learning.

Each year, educators submit applications for a Voya Unsung Heroes grant by describing projects they have initiated or would like to pursue. Each project is judged on its:

Innovative method
Creativity
Ability to positively influence the students

Each year, 50 finalists are selected to receive a $2,000 grant, payable to both the winning teacher and his or her school. At least one grant is awarded in each of the 50 states, provided at least one qualified application was received from each state. Winners are selected by Scholarship America, a national non-profit educational support and student aid service organization.

Attention Viking Families! Due to the storm we had over the weekend, MacNaughton Elementary and the Educational Service Center without power. We thank you for your understanding and patience in these circumstances.

Welcome to Wednesday Viking Nation! We want to wish a huge "GOOD LUCK” to our TC Odyssey of the Mind teams headed to the World competition today at Michigan State University. High school team members David Osbourne, Sawyer Lewis, Kayla Michael, Zach Princer, Trenton Laskey, and Anna Ketelaar, and Middle school team members Ava Longcore, Sam Patin, Katie Busch, Isabel Schuster, Alexis Gleason, and Julie Verberg, will take part in opening ceremonies, competitions, pin trading, closing ceremonies, and much more with teams from all across the country and the world.

The high school team, coached by Dave Princer, will compete on Friday morning at 8:45am, on the main floor of the Breslin Center. The middle school team, coached by Spencer Gould, will compete on Friday afternoon at 1:18pm, at the Board Business College.

Opening ceremony tonight and Awards and Closing ceremonies on Saturday night will be streamed live on the OM website at https://www.odysseyofthemind.com/. We are so PROUD of our TC Viking OMers!

A cafetorium is an acoustically designed performance space for concerts, music programs, plays, community events, etc., that is also utilized daily as cafeteria space for students.

Attention Viking Nation! We have some great news to share with you! We have been notified by the State of Michigan Department of Environment, Great Lakes and Energy (EGLE) that the new well at the Middle School is PFAS free! The new well will be able to serve the middle school and provide safe drinking water to our students, staff and community.

We also learned that Tri County has received a grant from the Department of Environment, Great Lakes and Energy for $92,520, that will pay for the majority of the cost of the new well and other expenses associated to the well work. A special thank you to Kathi Coffin and Brian Akey in securing the grant funds.
